verses.verse: בְּ֭נִי <S%H1121><s%> Be-ni My son לְחָכְמָתִ֣י <S%H2451><s%> le-cha-che-ma-Ti unto my wisdom הַקְשִׁ֑יבָה <S%H7181><s%> hak-Shi-vah; attend לִ֝תְבוּנָתִ֗י <S%H8394><s%> lit-vu-na-Ti, to my understanding הַט־ <S%H5186><s%> hat- [and] bow אָזְנֶֽךָ׃ <S%H241><s%> 'a-ze-Ne-cha. thine ear

לִשְׁמֹ֥ר <S%H8104><s%> lish-Mor That thou mayest regard מְזִמּ֑וֹת <S%H4209><s%> me-zim-Mot; discretion וְ֝דַ֗עַת <S%H1847><s%> ve-Da-'at, knowledge שְׂפָתֶ֥יךָ <S%H8193><s%> se-fa-Tei-cha and [that] thy lips יִנְצֹֽרוּ׃ <S%H5341><s%> yin-Tzo-ru. may keep

כִּ֤י <S%H3588><s%> ki for נֹ֣פֶת <S%H5317><s%> No-fet [as] an honeycomb תִּ֭טֹּפְנָה <S%H5197><s%> Tit-to-fe-nah drop שִׂפְתֵ֣י <S%H8193><s%> sif-Tei For the lips זָרָ֑ה <S%H2114><s%> za-Rah; of a strange woman וְחָלָ֖ק <S%H2509><s%> ve-cha-Lak [is] smoother מִשֶּׁ֣מֶן <S%H8081><s%> mish-She-men than oil חִכָּֽהּ׃ <S%H2441><s%> chik-Kah. and her mouth

וְֽ֭אַחֲרִיתָהּ <S%H319><s%> Ve-'a-cha-ri-tah But her end מָרָ֣ה <S%H4751><s%> ma-Rah is bitter כַֽלַּעֲנָ֑ה <S%H3939><s%> chal-la-'a-Nah; as wormwood חַ֝דָּ֗ה <S%H2299><s%> chad-Dah, sharp כְּחֶ֣רֶב <S%H2719><s%> ke-Che-rev sword פִּיּֽוֹת׃ <S%H6310><s%> pi-Yot. as a twoedged

רַ֭גְלֶיהָ <S%H7272><s%> Rag-lei-ha Her feet יֹרְד֣וֹת <S%H3381><s%> yo-re-Dot go down מָ֑וֶת <S%H4194><s%> Ma-vet; to death שְׁ֝א֗וֹל <S%H7585><s%> ol, on hell צְעָדֶ֥יהָ <S%H6806><s%> tze-'a-Dei-ha her steps יִתְמֹֽכוּ׃ <S%H8551><s%> yit-Mo-chu. take hold

אֹ֣רַח <S%H734><s%> 'O-rach the path חַ֭יִּים <S%H2416><s%> Chai-yim of life פֶּן־ <S%H6435><s%> pen- does not תְּפַלֵּ֑ס <S%H6424><s%> te-fal-Les; Lest thou shouldest ponder נָע֥וּ <S%H5128><s%> na-'U are moveable מַ֝עְגְּלֹתֶ֗יהָ <S%H4570><s%> ma'-ge-lo-Tei-ha, her ways לֹ֣א <S%H3808><s%> lo does not תֵדָֽע׃ <S%H3045><s%> te-Da'. [that] thou canst not know פ Peh

וְעַתָּ֣ה <S%H6258><s%> ve-'at-Tah Now בָ֭נִים <S%H1121><s%> Va-nim me now therefore O ye children שִׁמְעוּ־ <S%H8085><s%> shim-'u- Hear לִ֑י Li; וְאַל־ <S%H408><s%> ve-'al- not תָּ֝ס֗וּרוּ <S%H5493><s%> ta-Su-ru, and depart מֵאִמְרֵי־ <S%H561><s%> me-'im-rei- not from the words פִֽי׃ <S%H6310><s%> Fi. of my mouth

הַרְחֵ֣ק <S%H7368><s%> har-Chek far מֵעָלֶ֣יהָ <S%H5921><s%> me-'a-Lei-ha and דַרְכֶּ֑ךָ <S%H1870><s%> dar-Ke-cha; thy way וְאַל־ <S%H408><s%> ve-'al- not תִּ֝קְרַ֗ב <S%H7126><s%> tik-Rav, from her and come not nigh אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- about פֶּ֥תַח <S%H6607><s%> Pe-tach the door בֵּיתָֽהּ׃ <S%H1004><s%> bei-Tah. of her house

פֶּן־ <S%H6435><s%> pen- Or תִּתֵּ֣ן <S%H5414><s%> tit-Ten Lest thou give לַאֲחֵרִ֣ים <S%H312><s%> la-'a-che-Rim unto others הוֹדֶ֑ךָ <S%H1935><s%> ho-De-cha; thine honour וּ֝שְׁנֹתֶ֗יךָ <S%H8141><s%> u-she-no-Tei-cha, and thy years לְאַכְזָרִֽי׃ <S%H394><s%> le-'ach-za-Ri. unto the cruel

פֶּֽן־ <S%H6435><s%> pen- lest יִשְׂבְּע֣וּ <S%H7646><s%> yis-be-'U be filled זָרִ֣ים <S%H2114><s%> za-Rim Lest strangers כֹּחֶ֑ךָ <S%H3581><s%> ko-Che-cha; with thy wealth וַ֝עֲצָבֶ֗יךָ <S%H6089><s%> va-'a-tza-Vei-cha, and thy labours בְּבֵ֣ית <S%H1004><s%> be-Veit [be] in the house נָכְרִֽי׃ <S%H5237><s%> na-che-Ri. of a stranger

וְנָהַמְתָּ֥ <S%H5098><s%> ve-na-ham-Ta And thou mourn בְאַחֲרִיתֶ֑ךָ <S%H319><s%> ve-'a-cha-ri-Te-cha; at the last בִּכְל֥וֹת <S%H3615><s%> bich-Lot are consumed בְּ֝שָׂרְךָ֗ <S%H1320><s%> be-sa-re-cha, when thy flesh וּשְׁאֵרֶֽךָ׃ <S%H7607><s%> u-she-'e-Re-cha. and thy body

וְֽאָמַרְתָּ֗ <S%H559><s%> ve-'a-mar-Ta, And say אֵ֭יךְ <S%H349><s%> 'eich How שָׂנֵ֣אתִי <S%H8130><s%> sa-Ne-ti How have I hated מוּסָ֑ר <S%H4148><s%> mu-Sar; instruction וְ֝תוֹכַ֗חַת <S%H8433><s%> ve-to-Cha-chat, reproof נָאַ֥ץ <S%H5006><s%> na-'Atz despised לִבִּֽי׃ <S%H3820><s%> lib-Bi. and my heart

וְֽלֹא־ <S%H3808><s%> ve-lo-Sha- Nor שָׁ֭מַעְתִּי <S%H8085><s%> ma'-ti And have not obeyed בְּק֣וֹל <S%H6963><s%> be-Kol the voice מוֹרָ֑י <S%H3384><s%> mo-Rai; of my teachers וְ֝לִֽמְלַמְּדַ֗י <S%H3925><s%> ve-lim-lam-me-Dai, to them that instructed לֹא־ <S%H3808><s%> lo- Nor הִטִּ֥יתִי <S%H5186><s%> hit-Ti-ti nor inclined אָזְנִֽי׃ <S%H241><s%> 'a-ze-Ni. mine ear

כִּ֭מְעַט <S%H4592><s%> Kim-'at I was almost הָיִ֣יתִי <S%H1961><s%> ha-Yi-ti become בְכָל־ <S%H3605><s%> ve-chol- utter רָ֑ע <S%H7451><s%> Ra'; in all evil בְּת֖וֹךְ <S%H8432><s%> be-Toch in the midst קָהָ֣ל <S%H6951><s%> ka-Hal of the congregation וְעֵדָֽה׃ <S%H5712><s%> ve-'e-Dah. and assembly

שְׁתֵה־ <S%H8354><s%> she-teh- Drink מַ֥יִם <S%H4325><s%> Ma-yim waters מִבּוֹרֶ֑ךָ <S%H953><s%> mib-bo-Re-cha; out of thine own cistern וְ֝נֹזְלִ֗ים <S%H5140><s%> ve-no-ze-Lim, and running waters מִתּ֥וֹךְ <S%H8432><s%> mit-Toch out of בְּאֵרֶֽךָ׃ <S%H875><s%> be-'e-Re-cha. thine own well

יָפ֣וּצוּ <S%H6327><s%> ya-Fu-tzu be dispersed מַעְיְנֹתֶ֣יךָ <S%H4599><s%> ma'-ye-no-Tei-cha Let thy fountains ח֑וּצָה <S%H2351><s%> Chu-tzah; abroad בָּ֝רְחֹב֗וֹת <S%H7339><s%> ba-re-cho-Vot, in the streets פַּלְגֵי־ <S%H6388><s%> pal-gei- [and] rivers מָֽיִם׃ <S%H4325><s%> Ma-yim. of waters

יִֽהְיוּ־ <S%H1961><s%> yih-yu- become לְךָ֥ le-Cha לְבַדֶּ֑ךָ <S%H905><s%> le-vad-De-cha; alone וְאֵ֖ין <S%H369><s%> ve-'Ein else לְזָרִ֣ים <S%H2114><s%> le-za-Rim Let them be only thine own and not strangers' אִתָּֽךְ׃ <S%H854><s%> 'it-Tach. for

יְהִֽי־ <S%H1961><s%> ye-hi- Let מְקוֹרְךָ֥ <S%H4726><s%> me-kor-Cha Let thy fountain בָר֑וּךְ <S%H1288><s%> va-Ruch; be blessed וּ֝שְׂמַ֗ח <S%H8055><s%> u-se-Mach, and rejoice מֵאֵ֥שֶׁת <S%H802><s%> me-'E-shet with the wife נְעוּרֶֽךָ׃ <S%H5271><s%> ne-'u-Re-cha. of thy youth

אַיֶּ֥לֶת <S%H365><s%> 'ai-Ye-let hind אֲהָבִ֗ים <S%H158><s%> 'a-ha-Vim, [Let her be as] the loving וְֽיַעֲלַ֫ת־ <S%H3280><s%> ve-ya-'a-Lat- roe חֵ֥ן <S%H2580><s%> chen and pleasant דַּ֭דֶּיהָ <S%H1717><s%> Dad-dei-ha let her breasts יְרַוֻּ֣ךָ <S%H7301><s%> ye-rav-Vu-cha satisfy בְכָל־ <S%H3605><s%> ve-chol- all עֵ֑ת <S%H6256><s%> 'Et; thee at all times בְּ֝אַהֲבָתָ֗הּ <S%H160><s%> be-'a-ha-va-Tah, with her love תִּשְׁגֶּ֥ה <S%H7686><s%> tish-Geh and be thou ravished תָמִֽיד׃ <S%H8548><s%> ta-Mid. always

וְלָ֤מָּה <S%H4100><s%> ve-Lam-mah why תִשְׁגֶּ֣ה <S%H7686><s%> tish-Geh be ravished בְנִ֣י <S%H1121><s%> ve-Ni And why wilt thou my son בְזָרָ֑ה <S%H2114><s%> ve-za-Rah; with a strange woman וּ֝תְחַבֵּ֗ק <S%H2263><s%> u-te-chab-Bek, and embrace חֵ֣ק <S%H2436><s%> chek the bosom נָכְרִיָּֽה׃ <S%H5237><s%> na-che-ri-Yah. alien

כִּ֤י <S%H3588><s%> ki for נֹ֨כַח׀ <S%H5227><s%> No-chach [are] before עֵינֵ֣י <S%H5869><s%> 'ei-Nei the eyes יְ֭הוָה <S%H3069><s%> Yah-weh God דַּרְכֵי־ <S%H1870><s%> dar-chei- For the ways אִ֑ישׁ <S%H376><s%> 'Ish; of man וְֽכָל־ <S%H3605><s%> ve-chol all מַעְגְּלֹתָ֥יו <S%H4570><s%> ma'-ge-lo-Tav all his goings מְפַלֵּֽס׃ <S%H6424><s%> me-fal-Les. and he pondereth

עַֽווֹנוֹתָ֗יו <S%H5771><s%> a-vo-no-Tav, His own iniquities יִלְכְּדֻנ֥וֹ <S%H3920><s%> yil-ke-du-No shall take אֶת־ <S%H853><s%> 'et- הָרָשָׁ֑ע <S%H7563><s%> ha-ra-Sha'; the wicked וּבְחַבְלֵ֥י <S%H8551><s%> u-ve-chav-Lei himself and he shall be holden חַ֝טָּאת֗וֹ <S%H2403><s%> chat-ta-To, of his sins יִתָּמֵֽךְ׃ <S%H2256><s%> yit-ta-Mech. with the cords

ה֗וּא <S%H1931><s%> Hu, He יָ֭מוּת <S%H4191><s%> Ya-mut He shall die בְּאֵ֣ין <S%H369><s%> be-'Ein lack מוּסָ֑ר <S%H4148><s%> mu-Sar; without instruction וּבְרֹ֖ב <S%H7230><s%> u-ve-Ro and in the greatness אִוַּלְתּ֣וֹ <S%H200><s%> iv-val-To of his folly יִשְׁגֶּֽה׃ <S%H7686><s%> yish-Geh. he shall go astray פ Peh
